qas.question: Why are LED lights sought after for various applications?
Because of their high output, LED lights are very useful where?
LED brake lights are how many times faster than incandescent ones?
What color LEDs are now starting to be used more?
What types of light can LEDs form better than incandescent?
Why are non-LED lights sought after for various applications?
Because of their low output, LED lights are very useful where?
ED brake lights are how many times slower than incandescent ones?
What color LEDs are now not used more?

context: Because of <a0_0><b5_0>their long life<b5_0/><a0_0/>, fast switching times, and their ability to be seen in broad daylight due to their high output and focus, LEDs have been used in <a1_0><b6_0>brake lights for cars<b6_0/><a1_0/>' high-mounted brake lights, trucks, and buses, and in turn signals for some time, but many vehicles now use LEDs for their rear light clusters. The use in brakes improves safety, due to a great reduction in the time needed to light fully, or faster rise time, up to <a2_0><b7_0>0.5 second<b7_0/><a2_0/> faster[citation needed] than an incandescent bulb. This gives drivers behind more time to react. In a dual intensity circuit (rear markers and brakes) if the LEDs are not pulsed at a fast enough frequency, they can create a phantom array, where <b8_0>ghost<b8_0/> images of the LED will appear if the eyes quickly scan across the array. <a3_0>White<a3_0/> LED headlamps are starting to be used. Using LEDs has styling advantages because LEDs can form much <a4_0>thinner<a4_0/> lights than incandescent lamps with parabolic reflectors.
